definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: "Neng" is an auxiliary verb which means to have the ability to or possibility of doing something.
sentences.chinese: “能”是助動詞，表示有能力或者可能做某件事情。

sentences.english: How to use auxiliary verb better ?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣更好的運用助動詞？

sentences.english: Part 2 compares the auxiliary verbs in Ru Lin Wai Shi and those of each period of Chinese development.
sentences.chinese: 《儒林外史》助動詞與漢語各時期助動詞的比較。

sentences.english: Part 2 compares the auxiliary verbs in Ru Lin Wai Shi and those of each period of Chinese development.
sentences.chinese: 《儒林外史》助動詞與漢語各時期助動詞的比較。

sentences.english: Secondly, we study specifically the auxiliary verbs in Zhu Zi Yu Nei.
sentences.chinese: 其次，具體分析了《朱子語類》中的單音節助動詞。

sentences.english: Subiect is the third person, according to the agreement, which form of'have'should you use here?
sentences.chinese: 主語是第三人稱單數，根據主謂一致原則，助動詞。

sentences.english: In Chinese, the classification of the auxiliary verb and the adverb always have dispute.
sentences.chinese: 漢語中助動詞和副詞的分類一直有爭議。

sentences.english: What is a helping verb, then?
sentences.chinese: 那麼究竟什麼是助動詞呢？

sentences.english: "Gan" in Zhidan dialect of Northern Shaanxi is both an auxiliary verb and a degree adverb.
sentences.chinese: 陝北志丹方言中的“敢”既是助動詞，又是測度副詞。

definition: part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
